summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) guard, conducted on August 20, 2019, regarding his duties and observations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The guard discusses standard procedures, his treatment of Jeffrey Epstein as a prisoner, and awareness of Epstein's prior suicide attempt and status on a 'hot list'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: High-profile prisoner at MCC who died by suicide; was flagged on a 'hot list' and had a prior suicide attempt.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Conducted the interview along with other agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: Special Agent of the Office of the Inspector General
persons.context: Participated in the interview of the BOP guard.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Participated in the interview of the BOP guard.

persons.name: BOP Guard
persons.role: Senior Officer of Special Housing (SOS) and 2nd officer of the SHU
persons.context: Interviewed about his duties, procedures at MCC, and his knowledge of Epstein's status and prior suicide attempt.

connections.description: The guard was responsible for monitoring Epstein as a prisoner in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC.
The FBI and OIG agents interviewed the BOP guard regarding procedures and Epstein's incarceration.
The AUSA participated in the interview of the BOP guard.

events.title: Interview of BOP Guard
events.description: FBI, OIG, and AUSAs interviewed a BOP guard regarding prison procedures and his knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration.

events.title: Continuation of BOP Guard Interview
events.description: Further details of the interview with the BOP guard were recorded and attached to the report.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: Epstein died by suicide in his cell at MCC; this interview occurred after his death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: The BOP guard stated he treated Epstein the same as any other prisoner despite his high-profile status.
The guard was aware Epstein had a prior suicide attempt and was on a 'hot list' for monitoring.
The guard described standard procedures for conducting 'rounds' and 'counts' in the SHU, noting times are often approximated at shift end.
On the day prior to Epstein's death, the guard was aware Epstein was without a cellmate and notified relieving guards.
The interview was part of a post-death investigation involving multiple agencies (FBI, OIG, SDNY AUSAs).
